entry.title: BADI for Warehouse Task to Sort HU
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

Following is the requirement or question for SAP EWM Public Cloud.

We have requirement to create Putaway Warehouse Task with logic Full first and partial quantity to be the last WT sequence.

Example:
HU1 Qty Partial : 80
HU2 Qty Full: 100
HU3 Qty Full: 100
HU4 Qty Full: 100

So we expect that system will sequence Warehouse Task creation as follow:
Sequence 1 for HU2 (Qty: 100)
Sequence 2 for HU3 (Qty: 100)
Sequence 3 for HU4 (Qty: 100)
Sequence 4 for HU1 (Qty: 80)

Can anybody share some BADI on Warehouse Task creation for SAP Public Cloud?
Or can we configure (standard) with the above requirement?

Thanks.

entry.title: "set tracefile" doesn't display stored proc call params
entry.content:
I had a much longer question typed up, but when I choose a "board" for where to post this, the web page cleared out my text.

For finding slow queries you can execute the calls

  • set trace <filename> for <spid_to_trace>
  • set show_sqltext on  -- applies to spid_to_trace, not the current session
  • set show_<optimizer_option>
  • set tracefile off for <spid_to_trace>  -- very important, trace will continue after current session logs off

But the "set trace" command doesn't show parameters for stored proc calls.   Anyway to trace that info?

Thanks in advance
Ben

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About the SAP Young Professionals Program
entry.content:
If you’re an ambitious graduate looking to launch your tech consulting career, the SAP Young Professionals program might be the opportunity you’ve been waiting for! This free, immersive training experience opens doors to become an SAP Associate Consultant and kick-start your career among SAP's. 

What is the SAP Young Professionals program?

It is a free, 2-3 month intensive training initiative from the SAP Digital Skills Center that aims to equip recent university graduates (with less than 3 years of graduation) with SAP knowledge, soft skills, and certifications that prepare them for SAP consulting-related position within the EMEA region. 

Graduates are trained in SAP technologies such as: SAP S/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud, Artificial Intelligence, SAP Business Technology Platform, within others ((Modules may vary by cohort or region).

Who is eligible for the program?

Applicants typically need to meet the following criteria.

  • Hold a university degree (Bachelor’s or higher). 
  • Be a recent graduate (within the past 3 years).
  • Be currently unemployed or underemployed
  • Show strong English proficiency.
  • Be citizens or legal residents of the country where the program is being offered.

Note: Specific requirements may vary depending on country and region.

What does the program include?

Over the course of 2–3 months, participants will:

  • Earn globally recognized certifications 
  • Gain access to SAP Learning Hub and be trained by SAP specialists 
  • Develop soft skills
  • Have the possibility of starting your career as Associate Consultant in SAP's ecosystem (partners + customers)

Is the program really free?

Yes. The SAP Digital Skills Center delivers this program at no cost to participants as part of SAP’s mission to close the digital skills gap and support sustainable employment. SAP invests in rising talent to help drive digital transformation across industries.

Is employment guaranteed after completing the program?

While job placement is not guaranteed, one of the key goals of YPP is to connect graduates with SAP partners and customers who are actively hiring. Many graduates secure employment within the SAP ecosystem shortly after completing the program. However, success depends on the graduate's performance, certification results, and engagement throughout the course.

How to apply?

Applications are submitted via 👉 SAP Digital Skills Center portal.

Keep an eye on the website or SAP’s social media channels for announcements about new program cohorts in your region.

entry.title: Navigate the AI Era of Compliance:Join the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Virtual Summit 2025
entry.content:
Why Attend?

Whether you are already using SAP Document and Reporting Compliance or are exploring ways to digitalize and future-proof your statutory reporting and electronic invoicing processes, this one-day summit offers best practices, live demos, and customer experiences – all through the lens of innovation and compliance.

This year, we will explore:

✅How artificial intelligence is transforming compliance: Discover how embedded AI and SAP’s copilot Joule are helping companies resolve electronic document errors faster and more intelligently.

✅Emerging regulations, localized response: Stay on top of expanding mandates – from e-invoicing to e-reporting – across the globe, and see how SAP helps you adapt seamlessly with pre-built country-specific capabilities.

✅A future-ready roadmap: Hear from SAP experts about what is next for SAP Document and Reporting Compliance.

✅Customer voices: Learn directly from businesses navigating regulatory challenges today – what worked, what did not work, and how SAP Document and Reporting Compliance helped them simplify operations, reduce risks, and scale with confidence.

Compliance is not optional - but complexity can be

Today’s compliance challenges go beyond just checking boxes. Governments are enforcing real-time reporting, auditing more frequently, and expecting machine-readable transparency. It is no longer about just being compliant, but about being agile.

SAP Document and Reporting Compliance is built to help companies operating in multiple countries:

  • Integrate regulatory updates into processes – without disrupting operations
  • Standardize global compliance while meeting local requirements
  • Reduce manual tasks, risks, and costs with AI-driven automation

Let’s shape the future together

The SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Virtual Summit 2025 is more than just a product update event. It is a chance to connect with a global community, gain knowledge, and prepare your organization for whatever comes next – backed by SAP’s expertise in electronic documents processing and statutory reporting.

Whether you're a tax manager, IT lead, CFO, or localization expert – this event is for you.

Register now for free to secure your spot! We look forward to seeing you online on September 25.

 

Register now

 

Have a question? Drop it in the comments—our team is happy to help.

About the solution

SAP Document and Reporting Compliance is SAP’s end-to-end solution to help businesses meet local legal requirements for electronic documents processing worldwide. It streamlines electronic invoicing, statutory reporting, and audit obligations across countries – while enabling automation, scalability, and real-time compliance with confidence.

entry.title: Search Not Triggering on Enter in SAP Commerce Cloud 2211.3x using Composable Storefront
entry.content:
What is the issue?

If you’ve recently upgraded to SAP Commerce Cloud 2211.3x, you might have noticed a frustrating glitch in your Composable Storefront: pressing Enter after typing in the search box doesn't trigger a product search as expected. Instead, the search only works if the user clicks back into the search field with the mouse.

This unintuitive behavior can create confusion for end users, if there are multiple search box components are in play across different parts of your Composable Storefront.

How to Reproduce the Issue

To see the issue in action, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to your Composable Storefront
  2. Navigate to a catalog with available products
  3. Enter a term such as "ProductA" into one of the search boxes
  4. Press Enter
  5. Observe that nothing happens
  6. Click inside the search box again with your mouse, and only then will the expected suggestions and results appear

Root Cause

This behavior is caused by a redundant search completion reset in the SearchBoxComponent. The logic mistakenly blocks the search trigger when using the Enter key, even though it works via mouse interaction.

Good news: the issue has been fixed in SAP Commerce Cloud version 2211.42. The solution includes:

  • Removal of the redundant reset logic in theSearchBoxComponent
  • Restored support for search activation via the Enter key

To resolve the issue in your environment, simply upgrade to version 2211.42 or later.

Additional Resources

For projects currently on 2211.3x or earlier and facing this issue, it's strongly recommended to plan an upgrade to benefit from the fix and ensure optimal storefront functionality.

Fixed Issues for Composable Storefront Version 2211.42

entry.title: EXTERNAL JOIN when using temporary tables
entry.content:
Hello Community,

once again I'm dealing with a weird problem. This is my current setup:

  • Crystal Reports Designer 2016 (I need 32-bit compatibility at the moment)
  • Crystal Reports Runtime 13.0.38
  • SAP SQL Anywhere 17
  • all reports connect the database using ODBC

Some reports use global temporary tables for printing. Since the Crystal Reports Designer cannot access temporary tables, I create a persistent table with the same name and schema first.

In my sample report, it looks like this:

Tables A and B are joined on the MasterId field. The report generates the expected SQL query from this:

After creating the report, I convert the persistent table B back to a temporary table.

If I perform a “Verify Database” using the same database after that, I get a message that the database has changed.

This is okay, but now the SQL query looks like this:

It does not matter whether “Verify Database” is executed in the Crystal Reports Designer or (at runtime) via the API.

As a result, a separate SELECT statement is executed on table B for each record in table A at runtime to determine the data from table B.

Depending on the data set and data model of the report, this can result in tens of thousands of queries being fired at the database instead of just one. And this results in dramatic performance losses.

Is there any way to prevent this from happening?

entry.title: Re: 高级公司间库存转储 (5HP) SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
@Chenjiayan 第一个价格的问题，采购订单定价走的是自己的价格条件，应该不会找到销售那边维护的信息，而是SSCUI 102144 Determine Calculation Schema for Standard Purchase Orders 这里面决定出来的calculation schema (也就是pricing procedure), 这里标准的有如下三个。你打开采购订单里面的分析看看用得是哪个，然后也可以展开看看是哪个条件类型维护了价格，被找到了。

第二个缺少一个配置，这篇博客也专门提到了相对于1P9新增的配置，可以在本页面搜“为客户主数据维护对其发货的销售组织对应的供应商号码”加上这个配置应该就好了。如果没好的话，截屏麻烦把消息号展示出来.

entry.title: Re: BUILD Work Zone - HTML5 Business Solutions vs HTML5 a...
entry.content:
Hi @FabioPagoti ,

If you're looking for a simple single-tenant Business Solution I'd start with -

  • Refer to the CommonDataModel in Section 3: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/integrate-with-work-zone..html
  • Simple single tenant business solution: https://github.com/SAP-samples/build-workzone-integration/tree/main/standard/html5-content-provider-sample/ManageProducts

Unlike the the HTML5 Apps with the SaaS approuter, the above suggests maintaining a cdm.json file that contains your Common Data Model definition. you can refer to: https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-standard-edition/sap-build-work-zone-standard-edition/creating-cdm-json-file-for-multi-tenancy-html5-app?q=CDM for more details.
Once you deploy your mtar, you should be to integrate the Deployed single tenant business solution into Work Zone by creating a new "HTML5 Business Solution" from the Channel Manager.

Once you integrate your applications using the "HTML5 Business Solution", any subsequent deployment of you apps will update the content channel in Work Zone automatically, unlike the "HTML5 Apps" content provider where a manual refresh is required after each deployment.

Best,
Jawad

entry.title: Re: Comunidade SAP RJ
entry.content:
Olá Leonardo tudo bem ?

Então vamos separar e conceituar o que estamos falando pois desconfio que alguns amigos ou amigas em algum momento vai ver a nossa troca de mensagens e talvez não entenda a diferença de um para o outro.  

SAP INSIDE TRACK - é um evento global, organizado pela comunidade SAP, com o objetivo de promover o compartilhamento de conhecimento, experiências e novidades sobre a plataforma SAP. É um encontro onde profissionais, consultores, desenvolvedores e entusiastas da SAP se reúnem para aprender, discutir tendências e inovações, e expandir suas redes de contato.  Ele acontece em algumas cidades onde é possível realizar uma "mobilização" para que o evento aconteça.

MEETUPS - Literalmente traduzindo, são pequenos encontros como você falou, reuniões menores geralmente com objetivo de aumentar o entrosamento entre os novos membros e "antigos" membros da comunidade SAP de uma determinada região.

O que ocorre (e essa é a minha opinião). Quando temos um SIT é num sábado. Dura um dia inteiro etc. Para os que já foram, conhecem bem a mecânica.

Já um meetup,repito, na minha opinião, têm uma série de fatores que precisa se levado em consideração:

Onde vai ser realizado o evento? Qual o dia vai ser realizado o evento? A que horas vai ser realizado o evento? Dependendo do dia, do lugar e da hora muitos não vão ou porque é muito tarde, ou porque o acesso de onde a pessoa vai não é legal para essa pessoa e dependendo do dia, isso inviabiliza tudo. O nosso RJ é uma cidade violenta e perigosa de ponta a ponta e todas essas questões se esbarram entre elas.

Fora outros fatores que fogem ainda mais do "nosso" controle. Tenho amigos de mais de 20 anos de SAP que não curtem esse tipo de evento pois são tímidos ou introvertidos, mas nem por isso deixaram de ir em SITs passados e está tudo bem....

Enfim...é isso.

Vamos com tudo porque esse ano com a reforma tributária, migração do GRC para o DRC e clientes migrando para o S/4 vai faltar tempo de ter meetup kkkkkk

entry.title: Re: Change managers in LMS/LMS Admin side
entry.content:
Hello Lori,
Usually this is because the system identifies your employee as one that comes from SF (BIZX).
To change this try to change the value for field "User Source System", it comes as "SuccessFactors Platform" for employees that come from BIZX and "Learning" for employees that were created in LMS.

If you are passing your employees from SF to LMS, you can change it from Integration Center.
Otherwise, other option is to use the import tool , download the User template fill just the mandatory data, and use "Correct Source system" option, select Learning, and this should allow again to change the values directly from LMS.
Hope this can help.

Regards,

-Gerardo

entry.title: ABAP Platform pipeline in SAP CI/CD Service - release issue
entry.content:
Hi, 

I have a problem with my ABAP Platform pipeline, using SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery Service in BTP. The issue is with the Release part.

I have a Cloud Connector and destination (using Principal Propagation) ready. The deployment from SAP BAS works as expected. All necessary OData Services are active and whitelisted. However, there's 401 error when the pipeline is executed.

[2025-07-29T14:59:03.441Z] Sending GET request to http://XXX:400/sap/opu/odata/UI5/ABAP_REPOSITORY_SRV/

[2025-07-29T14:59:24.279Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - Command deploy failed with error : Request failed with status code 401
[2025-07-29T14:59:42.331Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - fatal error: errorDetails{"category":"undefined","correlationId":"n/a","error":"running shell script failed with /bin/sh: cmd.Run() failed: exit status 1","library":"SAP/jenkins-library","message":"step execution failed","result":"failure","stepName":"transportRequestUploadCTS","time":"2025-07-29T14:59:39.890292594Z"}
[2025-07-29T14:59:42.332Z] fatal transportRequestUploadCTS - step execution failed - running shell script failed with /bin/sh: cmd.Run() failed: exit status 1

 I use Job Editor configuration mode. No code is used for the pipeline. 

Upload credentials is Basic Auth. using my Username and Password. These are no issues with it, as I've tested successfully.

I also use Cloud Connector, with Location ID specified on the destination level.

I have a couple of doubts:

- I see the --config "ui5-deploy.yaml" is used. Is there any special ui5-deploy content I have to add? I use destination there.

- Is ABAP Platform Endpoint the URL that I can find on my Destination level?

- Location ID - documentation says it should be found on the Cloud Connector level in BTP Cockpit, but it's false. There's Location ID, but only on the Destination level.

Any idea what could be the issue?

BR,

Adrian

I have created a SAP Fiori Elements application, and I would like to preview a field when creating a new entity with a default creation from my CDS. My CDS for the work order is associated with an installation, and I can create an installation from the work order detail page. To do this, I am using the GetDefaultsForItem function. I have added the import function and the navigation annotations, as described in the documentation:
https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/#/topic/5ada91cc1ad8455bbfb7e6aee96383f2 

I am correctly calling the GetDefaultsForItem function:

And it returns the correct data:

But the entity is not pre-filled.

Additionally, I have also added the "SideEffects" annotation:

Do you have any idea what might be causing this issue, or any suggestions to resolve it?

Thank you in advance for your help!

entry.title: Re: SAP Analytics Cloud for planning - Change Table Funct...
entry.content:
Ismail

I am not aware of a similar API to check for story filter. But Story filter can be read using getDimensionFilters() of FileDatasource. Just try to console.log and see what it returns when you have "All" selected as selection. If it returns an array with All as the first member you can play around with array indexing.

https://help.sap.com/doc/1639cb9ccaa54b2592224df577abe822/release/en-US/index.html#FileDataSource_MgetDimensionFilters

Nikhil

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud : SAP Datasphere のプロビジョニング
entry.content:
本ブログはSAP Business Data Cloud(SAP BDC)のプロビジョニング方法についてガイドします。
※本ブログの原文はこちらです。また、最新アップデート情報の確認のために、併せてSAP BDCのマニュアルもご確認ください。

このシリーズは、次の 5 つブログで構成されます。

Part 1: SAP for Me によるSAP BDCのプロビジョニング
Part 2: SAP Datasphere のプロビジョニング
Part 3: SAP Analytics Cloud のプロビジョニング
Part 4: SAP Databricks のプロビジョニング、
Part 5: インテリジェント アプリとデータ パッケージのインストール

今回は、「Part 2: SAP Datasphere のプロビジョニング」です。


Part 2: SAP Datasphere のプロビジョニング

本ブログでは、Business Data Cloud Core を介して SAP Datasphere をプロビジョニングする方法について説明します。

  1. BDC アプリケーションのプロビジョニングを開始します。まずはSAP Datasphere から開始します。

     

  2. 表示される「SAP Datasphereのプロビジョニング」ダイアログで、ソリューション名、リソースグループ、ビジネスタイプなどの詳細を入力します。

     

  3. リソース グループがまだ作成されていない場合は作成します。
  4. クォータ割当セクションでは、SAP Business Data Cloudで利用可能な総Capacity Unitから割り当てたいクォータを指定します。

     


    注: 最低1532のCapacity Unitを指定する必要があります。Capacity Unitの計算の詳細については、 SAP Datasphere Capacity Unit Estimatorを参照してください。
  5. システム所有者のメールアドレスや名前などの入力情報は、設定パラメータセクションに記載されています。内容を確認し、情報を送信してください。
  6. BDCコックピットのプロビジョニングの際に選択した同じリージョンとデータセンターを選択します。

     

  7. プロビジョニングリクエストが送信されたことを通知する確認メッセージが表示されます。「リソースで表示」をクリックすると、指定されたリソースグループ内のテナントが表示されます。
  8. リソースタブでは、ソリューションのステータスは「処理中」で、プロビジョニングが完了すると「準備完了」に変わります。
  9. プロビジョニング中に指定されたSAP Datasphereのシステム所有者は、テナントがプロビジョニングされると電子メール通知を受け取ります。
  10. テナントの準備ができたら、「リソース」タブの下のリンクとテナントの詳細からテナントにアクセスできるようになります。
  11. 「顧客ランドスケープ」では、新しいテナントのシステムの詳細を確認できます。また、システム連携が視覚的に表示されるため、システムランドスケープを理解しやすく、操作しやすくなります。
  12. 次のステップとして、既に作成した「Formation」にテナントを追加し、BDCテナントを追加する必要があります。
  13. 製品とポートフォリオ > Business Data Cloud > 顧客ランドスケープ > Formation に移動します。
  14. 正しいFormationを選択し、「システムを含める」をクリックして、Formationに含める SAP Datasphere テナントを選択し、変更を保存します。

     

  15. 単一のSAP Datasphereテナントは、1つのFormationにのみ属することができ、複数のFormationに属することはできません。

これで、BDC Core 内で SAP Datasphere テナントが正常にプロビジョニングされました。

※ このブログの原文を書いてくれたShreyasri Boseに感謝します。

entry.title: Need a Function Module for mass activation/inactivation of Measuring Point in SAP
entry.content:
Measuring Point can be marked active/inactive individually using tcode IK02> Measuring Point> Functions> Activate/Inactivate.
But for doing it for multiple measuring points at once in bulk- a function module is needed.
Need help in that regard.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Need a Function Module for mass activation/inactivati...
entry.content:
You can use transaction IK08 to deactivate multiple measuring points. Select multiple lines from the output list then use menu path 'Goto - Functions - Activate<>Inactivate - Deactivate'

There is a non-released function TABLE_IMPTT_UPDATE that could be incorporate into a custom utility program to activate/deactivate measuring points / counters.
Set INHB_MP_BI-POINT and IMPTT_UPD-POINT to the measuring point
Set IMPTT_UPD-POINT-INACT to X to deactivate the measuring point or ' ' space to activate

entry.title: 亮点前瞻之 SAP ERP公有云2508中国本地化发布
entry.content:
随着数字化浪潮的汹涌澎湃，企业对高效、智能的财务管理解决方案的需求日益迫切。在这个充满机遇与挑战的时代，SAP全球化部门始终秉持着对客户需求的敏锐洞察，持续为中国市场量身定制本地化增强功能。从税务到资金管理，从报表生成到法规遵循，我们致力于为您的企业打造全方位、一站式的数字化转型支持。

        在本文中，我们将带您深入了解即将发布的ERP公有云2508版本中国本地化的诸多亮点功能，它们将为您的企业带来前所未有的便捷与高效，助力您在激烈的市场竞争中脱颖而出，迈向更加辉煌的未来。

 

中国本地化财务操作更新

中国过账功能更新

        在财务管理的精细化浪潮中，精准的账务处理是企业稳健运营的关键。自2508版本起，中国用户可以在激活相关的设置之后，实现清帐过程中的负过账。

        该功能将通过为相关清帐凭证的对应行项目打上反记账标签之后，巧妙地实现清帐科目的借贷方发生额冲抵，合计为零，从而有效地避免了清帐科目的发生额虚增的现象，确保财务数据的真实性和准确性。

        用户首先需要在国家版本中国(CN)中为CN激活SSCUI: 激活国家/地区的负过账。请注意，中国本地化过账的负过账，依旧严格遵循SAP ERP标准财务功能中对负记账的规则和要求，确保您的财务流程既高效又合规。

 图一：中国版本下负记账相关的SSCUI

 

 图二：中国版本下的清帐凭证

 

中国本地化资金方案更新

新字段“金融交易类型”(Financial Transaction Type)

        资金管理作为企业运营的血脉，其精准与高效直接关系到企业的资金周转和财务健康。2508版本在SAP ERP 公有云的中国资金解决方案中提供新字段“金融交易类型” (Financial Transaction Type):

  • Fiori 创建付款申请-中国 (Create Payment Requisitions - China)
  • Fiori管理付款申请-中国 (Manage Payment Requisitions – China)
  • BAdI: 中国、新加坡、泰国：扩展付款项目审批 (China, Singapore, Thailand: Extension of Payment Items Approval)

        用户可根据企业项目的具体情况，在中国资金方案中的付款申请中对字段“金融交易类型”进行精准维护；根据需要灵活调整中国银企直连EPIC BAdI接口；并在中国现金流量表(基于DRC)的配置中将“金融交易类型”指定给相关现金项。通过这一系列操作，企业能够依据金融交易类型，将银行转账交易精准划分到中国现金流量表（基于DRC）的不同现金项目中，进而确保财务报表的准确性和可追溯性，为企业的资金管理提供坚实的数据支持。

图三：在创建付款申请中维护“金融交易类型”

 

图四：在管理付款申请中维护“金融交易类型”

 

中国增值税发票管理(基于SAP DRC)更新

销项增值税发票管理功能更新 - 红字发票通知单编号

        在税务管理的数字化转型中，发票处理的自动化是提高效率、降低错误率的关键一步。从2508版本起，在直连场景下，用户将在“创建金税凭证应用”中体验到红字发票通知单流程的自动化革新。用户可直接在应用中完成红字通知单号的创建，并自动从税局同步获取通知单编号，这一流程的优化将极大地简化您的税务操作：

 

图五：处理红字通知单

 

具体步骤如下：

  1. 用户在SAP开票组件（如SD、FICA/CI等）中参照原始发票创建贷项凭证（Credit memo）。在“创建金税凭证”应用中选择SAP贷项凭证，点击“红字通知单号”按键。
  2. 弹出界面“输入贷项凭证的红字通知单号”中，用户只需直接填写原始蓝字发票信息，选择原因代码，然后点击“应用”即可触发系统自动创建并返回红字通知单编号。
  3. 点击界面上“发送/同步”按钮，获取税局回传的正式红字发票号。

注意事项：

  1. 用户可通过SAP最新发布的自动化流程，利用乐企提供的相关API，在SAP应用内直接完成红字发票的开具操作，这一创新流程将使您的税务处理更加高效、便捷。
  2. 对于采用第三方方案实现直连（电子税务局）的客户，SAP已与部分特定的第三方厂商完成了技术验证及系统联调，技术层面已具备通过SAP与第三方方案的集成方式实现自动开具红字发票的条件。然而，具体实施细节和适用性仍需客户在项目过程中与所选第三方厂商进一步确认。

 

进项增值税发票管理功能更新 - 同步进项税申报状态

        在税务申报的数字化进程中，实时、准确的申报状态同步是确保企业合规运营的重要保障。从2508版本起，在直连场景下，用户在管理进项增值税申报应用中，可以轻松申报当前有效税收期间的发票。选择申报按钮后，该期间状态将自动更改为中间状态“已发送以供申报”。税务部门完成期间申报处理后，申报结果将自动发送回SAP系统，期间状态也将随之自动更新。

        用户可通过查看新增的进项增值税申报日志，详细检查申报信息。每次更改期间状态时，系统都会生成相应的日志条目。对于直连场景的用户，“金税系统处理结果”和“详细信息”字段将包含税局返回的申报结果信息。

图六：查看进项税申报日志

 

        如果申报结果长时间未更新，用户可以利用新增的“同步期间状态”按钮手动触发更新。此外，在管理进项增值税发票应用中，用户还可以在清单页面中批量同步多个发票的状态，这一功能的引入将进一步提升您的税务管理效率。

 

图七：同步进项税状态

 

展望未来，充满希望

        展望未来，SAP全球化部门将继续以创新为驱动，以客户需求为导向，为您提供更加智能化、自动化的本地化解决方案。在云时代的浪潮中，我们将持续为您赋能，助力您的企业在合规运营和本地化管理的道路上稳步前行，共同迎接充满无限可能的明天。

        关于S/4HANA 2508中国本地化功能的更多详情信息，欢迎请参考链接。

entry.title: Re: Change managers in LMS/LMS Admin side
entry.content:
Hello @Lori13 

 

The message in the user record indicates that these fields are read-only since they are not directly managed by Learning. Instead, they are sourced from other modules, and the data is updated according to the information passed to Learning via the connector input file. In this case, it is not possible to update them manually directly from the UI.

You can update these fields via the Import Data tool; however, please keep in mind that if the respective field is mapped in the connector, it will be overwritten once the connector runs and sends a value to it.

You mentioned that you can update the field in BizX, but for some reason, the change is not reflecting in LMS. Typically, in the connector mapping, we’ll see sfuser.field.mapping.data.SUPER=MANAGER. This means that the BizX column SUPER is mapped to the Learning column MANAGER (Primary Manager). Please review (1) whether the column that contains the manager information in BizX is present in the user data file consumed by the learning connector, and (2) if the connector mapping is correct in Learning.

Best,

entry.title: Understanding the Difference Between Inventory Display and Future Stock Availability
entry.content:
SAP Commerce Cloud offers two features to manage and present stock-related information: Inventory Display and Future Stock Availability.

While both are focused on informing about product stock, they serve different purposes. Though they may appear similar at first glance, these features differ in goals, behavior, and configuration.

This blog aims to clarify the differences and help prevent confusion during implementation, configuration, or cross-team discussions.

So, what’s the difference between these two features?

Inventory Display – Managing What’s Shown for Current Stock

The B2B Inventory Display feature allows showing a threshold value instead of the actual stock quantity available for a product.

Example:
If there are 100 units in stock and the threshold is set to 15, the storefront will display:

  • "15+ in stock"

If there are 15 or fewer units, the actual number will be shown:

  • "12 in stock"

Why use it?
To prevent a few customers from buying out all stock of popular products as soon as they become available. This helps:

  • Distribute stock more fairly across customers
  • Improve the overall customer experience
  • Prevent monopolization of high-demand items

How to configure:

By category:

  1. Open the Backoffice Administration Cockpit
  2. Go to Catalog > Categories
  3. Select the desired category
  4. Under the Administration tab, set the Stock Level Threshold

By site:

  1. Open the Backoffice Administration Cockpit
  2. Go to WCMS > Websites
  3. Select the desired site (e.g., powertools)
  4. Under the Administration tab, set the Default Inventory Threshold Value

🛠️ This logic is handled by the commercefacades extension using the stockPopulator and VariantOptionDataStockPopulator.

Future Stock Availability – Indicating Upcoming Restocks

Future Stock Availability shows when and how many units of a product will become available again. It provides visibility into planned restocks.

Example:
On the product page, a logged-in user may see:

  • July 20 – 300 units
  • July 25 – 500 units

⚠️Note: This information is only visible to logged-in users. Anonymous users won’t see the Future Availability link.

Why use it?
To inform users about upcoming inventory and support purchasing decisions, especially when a product is currently out of stock.

How to configure:

Configure future stock values in Backoffice > Base Commerce > Futurestock, where quantities and dates are assigned to SKUs.

Technical behavior:

  • Managed by the FutureStockFacade
  • Handled by the ProductPageController
  • SKUs are processed as lists, not individually

Returns:

  • null if the system isn’t configured
  • An empty list if no future stock exists for the SKU(s)

How to disable it:

Future stock is enabled by default, but can be disabled via local.properties:

storefront.products.futurestock.enabled=false

Why Doesn’t Threshold Apply to Future Stock?

This is a frequent, and understandable, point of confusion.

If current stock displays “25+” based on a threshold, why does future stock show “99999” instead of applying the same rule?

The answer lies in the purpose of each feature. Inventory Display is a UI layer to strategically control how current stock is shown.  Future Stock Availability displays the exact restock quantity and date, meant for forecasting, not visibility control. Since its goal is transparency rather than display control, threshold logic is not applied to future stock data.

Final Thoughts:

While both features relate to stock display, they solve different business problems:

  • Inventory Display – Focused on strategic visibility and stock protection
  • Future Stock Availability – Focused on transparency and purchase planning

It’s common to expect both features to behave the same way, but this distinction is intentional, each was designed with a different purpose, and their behavior reflects this. That said, feedback is always welcome and can help shape future improvements.

entry.title: Webi Query Filter - Between Formula
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am trying to find a way to filter on my 'CreationDate' field to only return entries created from seven days ago (from current date) to current date. I've tried creating a 'detail' object with no luck. I have converted my 'CreationDate' field to a date field using the 'ToDate' function (varCreationDate), and then applying : =[varCreationDate] Between (RelativeDate(CurrentDate(); -7); CurrentDate())

with many different syntax and  iterations ran through Galileo AI with no luck. This seems like it should be a fairly intuitive, I'm hoping it is an easy fix! Thanks as always!!!

entry.title: Re: Accidental Use of “Maintain GR/IR Clearing Account” A...
entry.content:
Hello @Monali 

The user incorrectly used (App ID: F0842A)/Example: Maintenance of GR/IR Clearing Accounts and the Impact on Commitments, resulting in manual clearing of GR balances without corresponding invoices. This disrupts GR/IR reconciliation and blocks invoice posting via MIRO/automatic processes.

Correction (SAP-Recommended)

    Post Reversal via Journal Entry App ID: F0717A – Manage Journal Entries (New Version)

 This restores the financial balance but does not reopen the GR line in PO history.

Reversal Limitation:

  • No equivalent to FBRA in Public Cloud
  • MIGO/102 movement type not available for GR reversal

Optional: Raise an incident via SAP for me if multiple POs are impacted or if there's a need to adjust integration-dependent processes.

Let me know if it works

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: "cannot specify a NULL Key value for reference entity...
entry.content:
Hi @user116 

The exception message "Cannot specify a NULL Key value for reference entity STUD_ID" usually occurs due to file formatting issues, such as incorrect delimiters, misaligned columns, or incorrect end-of-line symbols. Please review the connector input file to confirm whether you notice any of these issues. To verify whether the correct connector template is being used, please refer to Downloading Learning Connector Templates.

Best,

entry.title: Including Payment Information in Personal Data Collection During Onboarding
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I would like to know if it's possible to include the Payment Information portlet in the Personal Data Collection (PDC) step during the Onboarding process, so that new hires can enter their bank details, and this information can flow directly into Employee Central (EC).

I tried adding the PaymentInformationV3 object in Manage Data > Hire Template, but I encountered the following error:
"The Hire Template does not support effective dated custom MDF objects. Go to Configure Object Definitions page and select each of the listed custom MDF objects, change the value of Effective Dating to None and try saving again. List of effective dated custom MDF objects to be checked: Payment Information."

 

Since Payment Information is an effective-dated object, I understand why this error is occurring. However, I have come across some SAP Notes and discussions suggesting that capturing bank details during onboarding is possible.
https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3073634

https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-onboarding/implementing-onboarding/personal-data-collection-configuration?locale=en-US

 

Is there any standard-supported way or best practice to achieve this?

Any guidance or examples would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you,
Anjali Bhardwaj

entry.title: Re: Joule does not execute transactional capacity.
entry.content:
Hi @guilherme_c , just on a highlevel can you confirm me the steps? (I am curious because in your case you mentioned that it suddenly stopped working but in my case it is like that since the start)

1. Joule / Work Zone / CIS Connectivity activated as per guide
2. All destinations (RT, DT and RFC) created as per guide to connect to the S/4 via cloud connector
3. Work Zone - Channel created and assigned to the system alias mentioned; configured to use the RT and DT as mentioned in the guide
4. Joule activated in Fiori (all catalogue and role/authorization related config done as required)
5. CIS (IPS job) configured and enabled with the RFC Destination used and S/4 as the source; WZ as the Target
6. Full/Sync job ran in IPS and we can see the correct data in IdP in WZ
7. Data exposed from S/4 (V2 in my case) for the concerned roles and consumed using the channel in WZ
8. The consumed data is split in the explorer in WZ as per standard roles and we can see the required Business Role/Fiori App/Semantic Objec-Action in the list as we are configuring
9. The user who is testing the scenario should be having the required BR in S/4, that roles should be showing assigned to the user in the IdP in WZ and the related Fiori Apps (and oData if any) should be activated and showing in WZ

Once the above scenario is achieved, the Joule in Fiori should be able to execute its transactional capabilities.

Correct me if you think I missed something that was done from your end?

Additionally, I have a question and it would be great to have some clarity:
I understand that ISLM has it's use cases when it comes to SAP Gen AI and crtain Joule scenarios, but for the basic configuration of Joule and it's transactional capabilities, do we need ISLM up and working?

entry.title: Duplicate Records in Datasphere Monitor – Replication Flow shows double entries, but not in target s
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We’re encountering unexpected behavior in SAP Datasphere, and we’d appreciate any insights or similar experiences you may have.

In our productive environment, we have several Replication Flows scheduled to run daily at 04:00 a.m. Today, they executed without any apparent issues. However, when reviewing the Datasphere monitor, it showed 41,310 entries, while in Eclipse (the system where our client consumes the data), only 20,656 records are present.

Monitor DS



Eclipse

 

This suggests a possible duplication in the Datasphere monitor, although the target system shows no such duplication.

A similar situation occurred about a month ago. At that time, we couldn’t find any relevant information, so we waited 24 hours before opening a case with SAP. Interestingly, the issue resolved itself the next day, and we considered it an isolated incident.

Now that it has happened again, we would like to ask:

  • Has anyone experienced a similar issue in Datasphere?

  • Is there any known root cause for this kind of duplication?

  • Are there any SAP Notes, blogs, or documentation that could shed light on this behavior?

Any help or guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance and best regards.

EBZ.

entry.title: Error while triggering notification using Situation Handling
entry.content:
Hello All,

When attempting to trigger a Fiori notification for Contract Expiry through Situation Handling, we encounter an error stating, "Destination and O'Auth Profile for SAP Cloud Service not maintained" in the SLG1 transaction.

We discovered that the cloud destinations ‘BWZ_Fiori_Notification’ and ‘Z_BWZ_NOTIFICATION’ are required, and without these destinations, situation handling cannot be triggered, even if the rest of the setup is complete.

To enable these destinations, we need access to the SAP Cloud Platform Cockpit, which is currently not activated in our system.

Could you please advise on how we can successfully trigger the Situation Handling notification on the 'On-Premise' system without these cloud configurations?

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: "cannot specify a NULL Key value for reference entity...
entry.content:
@user116

There is not a simple answer to this scenario. Usually, this error occurs because of formatting issues, so the entire input file should be reviewed. I'm unable to provide you with further guidance without accessing the environment and checking the implementation. However, based on the screenshot provided of the input file, the format does not correspond to the usual format of the SF User Connector. The connector template will help you with this.

Regarding how to add user data to the file, it depends on how the integration has been done. But as a starting point, please review the link: Initial Configuration for User Connector - SF | SAP Help Portal.

entry.title: Re: Accidental Use of “Maintain GR/IR Clearing Account” A...
entry.content:
Hello @Monali ,

If the clearing was made against clearing documents (e.g., clearing a PO line), you might try: App: “Clear GR/IR Clearing Differences”
Try to find the cleared line items and reverse the clearing. Alternatively, use App: “Reset Cleared Items” (only available in specific roles or for open item managed accounts).

Please Note: Resetting cleared items is not always available in Public Cloud. If the functionality is not available in your tenant, you need to raise incident to SAP.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: 客户对S/4HANA Public Cloud的账套需求
entry.content:
@JuliaLu ,

Follow below steps:-

1. Scoping Phase (Critical Setup Step)
During initial system setup in SAP Central Business Configuration (CBC), select scope items to enable multiple ledgers:
J58 – Enables mandatory 0L ledger (local GAAP).
1GA – Enables 2L ledger (e.g., for Austrian GAAP).
2VA – Enables 3L ledger (e.g., for Chinese GAAP).
Plese note - Important: Ledgers cannot be added/removed after go-live and productive use.

2. Define Accounting Principles
Use the "Manage Your Solution" app or CBC to define:
ATGAAP – Austrian Accounting Standards
CNAP – Chinese Accounting Standards

3. Assign Principles to Ledgers & Company Codes
Assign accounting principles to:
0L → Local GAAP
2L → ATGAAP
3L → CNAP
Activate relevant ledgers for each applicable company code.

4. Configure Valuation Approaches (if needed)
Define different rules per ledger for:
Asset Accounting (e.g., depreciation)
Inventory Valuation
Foreign Currency Valuation

5. Master Data
Ensure master data supports ledger-specific values where applicable (e.g., asset master).

6. Reporting
Use standard reporting apps (e.g., "Financial Statements") to report by ledger (0L, 2L, 3L).

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: (Custom) Idoc: issue when changing data type of a field
entry.content: Hello Ryan, thanks again... Do you mean creating a new version for the segment type by transaction WE31?

entry.title: Re: Error on the connector log details
entry.content:
Hi @user116 

This error message relates to the exception: 'Cannot specify a NULL Key value for reference entity STUD_ID.' It is likely that the number of columns containing user data does not match the number of columns in the header. For example, the header might have 15 columns, while the input file contains only 14 columns of user data. This issue could also indicate other formatting problems, such as missing or incorrect delimiters or end-of-line symbols.

entry.title: Re: (Custom) Idoc: issue when changing data type of a field
entry.content: @Giovanni--  you would need an IDoc version because EDID4 doesn't store versions of segments, so it would have no reference to whether a segment would be new vs. old.
